title: Bug 37021 - Source path incorrect in declare warning on binary files
description: When targeting .class files from injars, the source path in declare warning messages is displayed incorrectly as 'app.Main.class' instead of 'app/Main.class'. To reproduce the issue, please refer to the code located at tests/new/binaryWarnings/.. . It is important to note that these tests have limitations as they may yield false positives when detecting this error due to the absence of filename checking in harness verification of messages. In AJDT, it is observed that if the filename does not make sense to AJDT, it is simply omitted from the declare warning message.
OB: When declaring warnings on binary files, the source path is displayed incorrectly as 'app.Main.class' instead of 'app/Main.class'. This issue has been observed in AJDT where the filename is sometimes omitted from the warning message if it does not make sense to AJDT.
EB: In declare warning messages when targeting .class files from injars, the sourcepath is listed in the form 'app.Main.class' rather than 'app/Main.class'.
SR: Please modify the declare warning messages to display the correct source path in the form 'app/Main.class' instead of 'app.Main.class' when targeting .class files from injars.
